intro: Curculigo sabui, commonly known as the mountain arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its tuberous roots and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
